block.p: Holly Thompson Mitchell, a daughter of Dorothy and John P. Mitchell of Chatham Township, N.J., was married last evening to Samuel Greenwood Dellenbaugh, the son of Joanna and Geoffrey G. Dellenbaugh of Madison, N.J. The Rev. Franklin Vilas performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Chatham.

Mrs. Dellenbaugh, 27, was until late last month an associate in litigation at Coudert Brothers, the New York law firm. Next month, she is to take a similar position at Orrick, Herrington & Sutcliffe, also in New York. She graduated from Yale University and Fordham Law School. Her mother is a family therapist in Maplewood, N.J. Her father is a partner in the New York law firm of Cahill Gordon & Reindel.

Holly Thompson Mitchell, a daughter of Dorothy and John P. Mitchell of Chatham Township, N.J., was married last evening to Samuel Greenwood Dellenbaugh, the son of Joanna and Geoffrey G. Dellenbaugh of Madison, N.J. The Rev. Franklin Vilas performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Chatham.

Mrs. Dellenbaugh, 27, was until late last month an associate in litigation at Coudert Brothers, the New York law firm. Next month, she is to take a similar position at Orrick, Herrington & Sutcliffe, also in New York. She graduated from Yale University and Fordham Law School. Her mother is a family therapist in Maplewood, N.J. Her father is a partner in the New York law firm of Cahill Gordon & Reindel.

Mr. Dellenbaugh, 26, was until June an Army captain with the First Armored Division, stationed in Baumholder, Germany, and in Bosnia. In September, he is to begin a premedical program at Columbia. His mother, a sculptor, owns Bartley House Antiques in Summit, N.J. His father is an executive director at the Robert Wood Johnson Pharmaceutical Research Institute in Raritan, N.J.
